basics.name: Mark Nemec
basics.summary: 4th year Computer Science student at the University of Edinburgh.

work.summary: Tutor for a first year course on functional programming with Haskell.

Got into the internship programme in 2013 and was offered a part-time position for the next year. Returned as an intern in summer 2014. Most of the work revolved around writing and maintaining scrapers in Python but got involved in several other projects as well.
highlights: Price parsing algorithm that can deal with most currencies and price formats
Script fetching many concurrent requests using Python 3 asyncio library
Worked with multiple web frameworks: Flask, Django, Angular

work.summary: Worked part-time on multiple Django apps with Danger Farms while in 2nd year of university. Learned to work with web frameworks and became proficient in Python.

Created a prototype for an Android app called tourcentrope. The app was aimed at tourism on the borders of Slovakia, Czech Republic, Austria and Hungary. Worked on all aspects of the app - from software architecture to user interface.
Created and designed a website for a mountain-biking project in Štiavnické Vrchy mountain range in Slovakia.

volunteer.summary: The aim of the project was to help upkeep buildings of various religions and meet people from different cultures.

awards.title: Netcraft Prize
awards.summary: The Netcraft Prizes are awarded to the 6 undergraduate students with best performance in third year.

awards.title: Best Game Prize
awards.summary: Manager and developer of a team that was awarded the prize for the best game.
